metadata.title: USN-3391-1 -- Firefox vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, bypass sandbox restrictions, obtain sensitive information, spoof the origin of modal alerts, bypass same origin restrictions, read uninitialized memory, cause a denial of service via program crash or hang, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-7753, CVE-2017-7779, CVE-2017-7780, CVE-2017-7781, CVE-2017-7783, CVE-2017-7784, CVE-2017-7785, CVE-2017-7786, CVE-2017-7787, CVE-2017-7788, CVE-2017-7789, CVE-2017-7791, CVE-2017-7792, CVE-2017-7794, CVE-2017-7797, CVE-2017-7798, CVE-2017-7799, CVE-2017-7800, CVE-2017-7801, CVE-2017-7802, CVE-2017-7803, CVE-2017-7806, CVE-2017-7807, CVE-2017-7808, CVE-2017-7809)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3391-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  firefox-locale-nl - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2 firefox-locale-nn - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2 firefox-locale-nb -
